div.p: As the COVID-19 pandemic affects Camden and South Jersey, our care teams are continuing to support the vulnerable individuals we serve. As part of our new COVID-19 response workflows, each day, we are gathering updates from our partner organizations about their current operational status so we can pass this information along to patients, providers, and other community partners.

This page will be updated Mondays through Fridays with new information about services and resources available in Camden and South Jersey. Please check back frequently as we will post new information as it becomes available.
If you have questions about any of the services listed here, please call them directly. For more information about services in South Jersey generally, visit My Resource Pal.

p.em: Last updated: Tuesday, April 28 at 2:30 PM.

tr.td:
Open.
No visitors allowed, with limited exceptions.
COVID-19 testing available at 1210 Brace Rd., Cherry Hill, and can analyze these tests in the Cooper labs.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open. No visitors allowed. Only one person in ED with a patient and one person in maternity and L&D with patient, and those individuals must stay with the patient the whole time. Cancellation of a lot of elective procedures."}
td.br:
No visitors allowed, with limited exceptions.
All elective procedures postponed.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open regular hours. Taking walk-ins. COVID-19 testing site."}
td.br:
Telemedicine only for established patients; new patients will be seen in the mobile truck.
Taking walk-ins.
COVID-19 testing site for new and established patients exhibiting symptoms.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open regular hours. Patients who are having respiratory symptoms must call before going to office, and will not be able to go to the office if they have any COVID-19 symptoms."}
td.br:
Providing telemedicine options.
Anyone entering the building will be screened for COVID-19 symptoms.
Patients who are having respiratory symptoms must call before going to office, and will not be able to go to the office if they have any COVID-19 symptoms.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open 8:30 AM - 5 PM. Patients who need medication refills may be asked to come in or will receive refills over the phone."}
td.br:
Screening everyone for COVID-19 symptoms at check-in; anyone with symptoms will seen by a nurse for triage.
Patients who need medication refills may be asked to come in or will receive refills over the phone.
Behavioral health appointments via telemedicine.
All newborns and children under age 2 are being seen in the office.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open regular hours. Sick visits only. Optometry and routine dental appointment are postponed."}
td.br:
Sick visits only in office; other visits via telemedicine. Not scheduling new appointments until after April 20, 2020.
North, South, and Odessa offices have been consolidated.
Optometry and routine dental appointment are postponed.
New mental health counseling patients accepted.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open regular hours. Sick visits only; rescheduling follow-up appointments."}
td.br:
Sick visits only in office; other appointments via telemedicine.
Rescheduling follow-up appointments.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open 8 AM - 4 PM. Sick visits only. Starting 3/20/19, will only see patients in the office in the morning; afternoon visits will be over the phone. Patients can get prescription medication over the phone if they have been to the office in the past 6 months. All pain medication requests are subject to physician approval."}
td.br:
Sick visits only.
All appointments in the morning will be via telemedicine; afternoon appointments will be in the office.
Patients can get prescription medication over the phone if they have been to the office in the past 6 months. All pain medication requests are subject to physician approval.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open normal hours. Patients only, no accompanying visitors. Patients may bring children if they cannot secure childcare. All individuals will have their temperatures taken before entering the building."}
td.br:
Non-urgent visits are being rescheduled or conducted via telehealth.
Prenatal visits are happening in-office, no accompanying visitors. Please call ahead if you are bringing children with you.
All individuals will have their temperatures taken before entering the building.

Monday 12:30 – 5 PM; Tuesday 9 AM – 12 PM; Wednesday 12:30 – 5 PM; Thursday 12:30 – 5 PM; Friday 9 AM – 12 PM.
Providing combination of in-office and telemedicine visits.
When you call to schedule, you will be screened to see if you need an in-office or telemedicine visit.
No visitors allowed with patients.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open regular hours. Outpatient services will continue and will primarily address medication needs and continue to provide tele-psych services. Both the Camden and Cherry Hill locations will remain open with restrictions on the number of people in the building."}
td.br:
Outpatient services will continue and will primarily address medication needs and continue to provide tele-psych services.
Both the Camden and Cherry Hill locations will remain open with restrictions on the number of people in the building.
New patients may walk-in to receive services at both the Camden and Cherry Hill locations.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Group sessions cancelled. Doctor's visits and individual counseling only."}
td.strong: Doctor’s visits and individual counseling only.
td.br: Group sessions cancelled.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Only two appointments can happen at the same time. Everyone must sanitize hands prior to entering and as they leave the building."}
td.strong: Open. Only two appointments can happen at the same time.
td.br:
Everyone must sanitize hands prior to entering and as they leave the building.
Based on medical provider recommendation, some clients on phase 2 are being given take-home methadone to reduce in-person visits.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Only two appointments can happen at the same time. Everyone must sanitize hands prior to entering and as they leave the building."}

tr.td:
Peer support via telephone.
Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday 12 -7 PM

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Only two appointments can happen at the same time. Everyone must sanitize hands prior to entering and as they leave the building."}

tr.td:
Offices are closed.
Providing services through telemedicine and video sessions.
Questions about upcoming appointments at the Berlin site should call and leave a message. They will return calls within 24 hours.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Only two appointments can happen at the same time. Everyone must sanitize hands prior to entering and as they leave the building."}

tr.td: Oaks Integrated Care-Intensive Case Management Services

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"No home visits. Remote work only unless absolutely necessary, which may include dropping off medication and food."}
td.br: All staff are working remotely unless necessary, which may include dropping off medication and food. No physical contact with patients, including providing transportation to appointments.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Reducing to 50 beds, no new intakes, no day services. Checking temperatures."}
td.br:
Reducing to 50 beds, no day services. Checking temperatures and screening for COVID-19 symptoms.
Providing outreach services in parking lot 8 AM – 12 PM, including food, hand washing, restrooms, and some service referrals.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Closed to the public. Conducting new inspections only. Yearly inspections are being delayed."}
td.br:
Conducting new inspections only.
Conducting phone interviews.
Yearly inspections are being delayed.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"At capacity. Curfew now at 8 PM instead of midnight."}
td.br: Clients are sheltering in place but can leave for appointments and programs as necessary.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Remote intake and office intake between the hours of 7am-6pm"}
td.strong: Remote intake and office intake 7 AM – 6 PM.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Closed to clients. Calling individuals and delivering food if needed."}
td.br: Calling individuals and delivering food if needed.

tr.td: STARZ Adult Medical Day Care Center

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Closed to clients. Conducting well checks via phone and delivering food, including on Saturdays"}
td.br: Conducting well checks via phone and delivering food, including on Saturdays.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open, using Saturday hours (9 AM - 2:30 PM). Screening all patients for COVID-19 symptoms. No visitors."}

tr.td:
Closed to clients.
Conducting well checks via phone, and delivering food and water as needed.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Closed to clients. Calling individuals and delivering food if needed."}
td.br: Calling individuals and delivering food if needed.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Closed to clients. Calling individuals and delivering food if needed."}
td.br: Calling individuals and delivering food if needed.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Closed until 3/27 at least except for urgent matters. Mercer, Morris/Sussex completely closed."}

tr.td: Sessions are canceled through 4/26/20. See the Municipal Court Closures site for specific details about each court.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Suspended all non-emergency in-person matters indefinitely. Certain matters will be handled by video conference where possible. "}

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"To the extent practicable, all court matters including hearings, conferences, and arguments, will be conducted by video or phone conferencing, and in-person appearances will be permitted only in emergency situations. Special Civil Part (DC) and Small Claims (SC) trial calendars are suspended through April 26, 2020. No new civil or criminal jury trials will be conducted until further notice."}

td.span: To the extent practicable, all court matters including hearings, conferences, and arguments, will be conducted by video or phone conferencing, and in-person appearances will be permitted only in emergency situations. Special Civil Part (DC) and Small Claims (SC) trial calendars are suspended through April 26, 2020. No new civil or criminal jury trials will be conducted until further notice. More information available here.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Courts are beginning to hold video hearings. Call your public defender for more information"}

tr.td: Courts are holding video hearings. Call your public defender for more information.

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Additional adjournments for initial civil commitment proceedings as described in the linked notice."}

td.span: Hearings may be further postponed an additional 7 (juvenile) or 14 (adult) days. Contact public defender or hospital staff for information about a specific hearing.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"While schools are closed, all students will be able to have access to meals, breakfast & Lunch. Meals will only be distributed on Mondays and Thursdays. Enough food will be sent home for several days. For example, on Mondays enough food will be provided for three days (Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday) and Thursday enough food will be provided for two days (Thursday and Friday). Hours of Operation: Monday and Thursday from 10 AM to 12 PM.\n\nAll students will be able to receive meals at one of the meal sites regardless of the school they attend. Please visit the meal site that is closest to your home. "}
td.strong: While schools are closed, all students will be able to have access to breakfast and lunch.
td.br:
Meals will only be distributed on Mondays and Thursdays. Enough food will be sent home for several days. For example, on Mondays enough food will be provided for three days (Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday) and Thursday enough food will be provided for two days (Thursday and Friday).
Hours of operation: Monday and Thursday from 10 AM to 12 PM. Visit website for list of meal pickup sites.
Map of meal distribution sites: https://www.camdenenrollment.org/accesstomeals

tr.td:
Handing out meals from the front door Monday – Friday from 3:15 – 5 PM, and Saturday 12 – 1 PM.
Restrooms are closed; providing hand wipes and bottled water with each meal.
No dine-in service until further notice.

td.strong: Closed Mondays. Continuing meal delivery Tuesdays-Fridays.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Sites open. Guests not required to sign-in, so no one will be turned away. Continuing to update this food locator: https://foodbanksj.org/zip-code-locator/ "}
td.br:
Guests not required to sign-in, so no one will be turned away.
Continuing to update this food locator: https://foodbanksj.org/zip-code-locator/

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Mornings only. Appointments required. Areas of service provided for residents of Camden City, Ashland Audubon, Barrington, Bellmawr, Brooklawn, Cherry Hill, Collingswood, Delair, Gloucester City, Merchantville, Oaklyn, Pennsauken. Emergency food is availabe for the ones who are in immediate need. Must have ID. Speak to Amarillis Food Pantry Coordinator."}
td.br:
Appointments required.
Please call 856-379-6900 to make an appointment.
Must show ID.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Camden County Division of Senior and Disabled Services"}

tr.td: Camden County Division of Senior and Disabled Services

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Providing meals to any senior in need regardless of prior registration. To request assistance, residents should contact the Division at 856-374-MEAL or 856-858-3220."}
td.strong: Seniors in need of meals – for any reason – can call (856) 374-MEAL to make immediate arrangements.
td.br:
All residents previously enrolled in the Camden County Nutrition Program have automatically begun receiving home-delivery of meals.
Senior and disabled residents, as well as neighbors and family of those in need, can call (856) 858-3220 to receive assistance.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open Mondays 6 - 7:30 PM, doors open at 5 PM."}

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Every Monday from 6:00 pm - 7:30 pm at 2755 Tuckahoe Rd, Camden NJ they will be giving groceries to families. [Distribution lasts until supplies run out.] "}
span.strong: Grocery distribution for families every Monday from 6:00 – 7:30 PM.
span.br:
2755 Tuckahoe Rd, Camden NJ.
Distribution lasts until supplies run out.
Adults will need ID and verification of dependents or number of people living in the household.

tr.td: Parkside United Methodist Church food pantry

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open Mondays 6 - 7:30 PM, doors open at 5 PM."}
td.br: ID required.

tr.td: Magnolia United Methodist Church food pantry

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Open Mondays 6 - 7:30 PM, doors open at 5 PM."}

tr.td:
Open Sundays 12 – 2 PM.
Also provides deliveries for elderly individuals.

div.h3: Government agencies, benefits, taxes, and voting

tr.td: Department of Child Protection and Permanancy (DCPP)

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"All visits suspended for at least 30 days. Caseworkers are coming up with plans for remote visits supervised by caregivers."}

tr.td: All visits suspended for at least 30 days. Caseworkers are coming up with plans for remote visits supervised by caregivers.
Camden County Board of Social Services

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Reduced operations. All face-to-face requirements are waived."}

span.data-sheets-value:
{"1":2,"2":"All face-to-face requirements are being waived. Interviews can now be completed over the phone. Staff will be reaching out to anyone already scheduled for a face-to-face to switch them to a phone interview or to reschedule. All new interviews will be scheduled for telephone calls Clients are directed to apply for all programs via njhelps.org.
Paperwork can still be dropped off at the Board of Social Services in Camden via the mailbox adjacent to the entrance. Paperwork does not have to be handed to a staff member.
All work activity requirements for TANF/GA/SNAP are being waived. Clients can reach out to their case managers if their current site is closing due to coronavirus concerns.
TANF and GA recipients that are due for recertification in March and April are receiving a 60-day extension."}

td.span: All face-to-face requirements are being waived. Interviews can now be completed over the phone. Staff will be reaching out to anyone already scheduled for a face-to-face to switch them to a phone interview or to reschedule. All new interviews will be scheduled for telephone calls.

p.strong: Clients can apply for programs directly at njhelps.org.

span.data-sheets-value:
{"1":2,"2":"All face-to-face requirements are being waived. Interviews can now be completed over the phone. Staff will be reaching out to anyone already scheduled for a face-to-face to switch them to a phone interview or to reschedule. All new interviews will be scheduled for telephone calls.
Clients are directed to apply for all programs via njhelps.org.
Paperwork can still be dropped off at the Board of Social Services in Camden via the mailbox adjacent to the entrance. Paperwork does not have to be handed to a staff member.
All work activity requirements for TANF/GA/SNAP are being waived. Clients can reach out to their case managers if their current site is closing due to coronavirus concerns.
TANF and GA recipients that are due for recertification in March and April are receiving a 60-day extension."}

p.span: Paperwork can be dropped off at the Board of Social Services in Camden via that mailbox adjacent to the entrance. Paperwork does not need to be handed to a staff member.

span.data-sheets-value:
{"1":2,"2":"All face-to-face requirements are being waived. Interviews can now be completed over the phone. Staff will be reaching out to anyone already scheduled for a face-to-face to switch them to a phone interview or to reschedule. All new interviews will be scheduled for telephone calls.
Clients are directed to apply for all programs via njhelps.org.
Paperwork can still be dropped off at the Board of Social Services in Camden via the mailbox adjacent to the entrance. Paperwork does not have to be handed to a staff member.
All work activity requirements for TANF/GA/SNAP are being waived. Clients can reach out to their case managers if their current site is closing due to coronavirus concerns.
TANF and GA recipients that are due for recertification in March and April are receiving a 60-day extension."}

p.span: All work activity requirements for TANF/GA/SNAP are being waived. Clients can reach out to their case managers if their current site is closing due to COVID-19. TANF and GA recipients who are due for recertification in March and April are receiving a 60-day extension.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Office closed until 3/30/20. All drivers licenses, non-drivers IDs, and inspection stickers expiring before May 31 have been etended by 2 months. Renewals, replacements, changes of address, and other transactions can be processed online at njmvc.gov"}
td.br: All drivers licenses, non-drivers IDs, and inspection stickers expiring before May 31 have been extended by 2 months. Renewals, replacements, changes of address, and other transactions can be processed online at njmvc.gov

tr.td: Sign up for a mail-in ballot for New Jersey’s primary election on July 7.
Deadline for filing taxes has been extended. Learn more.
Unemployment, temporary disability, family leave, workers’ compensation

Visit nj.gov/labor to apply for benefits.
Check eligibility: English | Spanish

Open regular hours.
Will transport for COVID-19 testing, but require 2 days notice.

td.span:
Rides provided 10am-2pm, Monday through Friday.
2 weeks advance notice required.
Office open 9 AM – 12 PM.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely. \nIndividuals in need of legal assistance can leave a message at 856-858-9500. Staff will return the call from a private number, within three business days. \nCurrent clients can call the same number and leave a message for their case handler at that person’s extension."}
td.strong: Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely.
td.br:
Individuals in need of legal assistance can leave a message at 856-858-9500. Staff will return the call from a private number, within three business days.
Current clients can call the same number and leave a message for their case handler at that person’s extension.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Camden Center for Law and Social Justice"}
td.data-sheets-formula: =HYPERLINK("https://camdenlawandjustice.org/","Camden Center for Law and Social Justice")
td.a: Camden Center for Law and Social Justice

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely. \nAvailable during normal business hours by phone at 856-583-2950. \nAlso available by e-mail at: info@cclsj.org."}
td.strong: Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely.
td.br:
Available during normal business hours by phone at 856-583-2950.
Also available by e-mail at info@cclsj.org.

td.data-sheets-value:
{"1":2,"2":"Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely. 
Individuals with new legal issues can email intake@aidslawpa.org or complete an intake at aidslawpa.org/intake. 
Individuals can also leave a message at 215-821-7899. Messages will be returned within 8 business hours. 

If you want to leave a message for a specific person, call the office at 215-587-9377 and use the dial-by-name directory."}
td.strong: Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely.
td.br:
Individuals with new legal issues can email intake@aidslawpa.org or complete an intake at aidslawpa.org/intake.
Individuals can also leave a message at 215-821-7899. Messages will be returned within 8 business hours.If you want to leave a message for a specific person, call the office at 215-587-9377 and use the dial-by-name directory.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely. \nTo contact, email sjls@lsnj.org, call 1-800-496-4570, or use the “contact us” form on the website at www.lsnj.org/sjls. Response time may take longer than usual."}
td.strong: Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely.

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Assisting clients and conducting intake remotely. Please contact our office at 800-922-7233 or advocate@drnj.org for assistance. We are returning calls and emails as soon as possible, usually within 48 hours. You can also follow us on social media https://www.facebook.com/disabilityrightsnewjersey or https://twitter.com/advocateDRNJ for updates. ​ Or at our new website drnj.covid.org."}

br.span: Contact our office at 800-922-7233 or advocate@drnj.org for assistance. Returning calls and emails as soon as possible, usually within 48 hours.

td.data-sheets-value:
{"1":2,"2":"
 
5 meetings are an All Recovery based format so that they are available to the widest number of those in, seeking or supportive of recovery. They are being held at 8 am, 11 am, 2 pm, 5 pm and 10 pm. 
 
On Tuesday night at 7:30 pm we are offering a solution based, facilitator led AA Step speaker, discussion meeting. 
 
Join Zoom Meeting (video and/or audio from computer) 
 
https://zoom.us/j/403598935 
 
or One tap mobile - +16468769923,403598935# 
 
or Dial-in +1 646 876 9923 Meeting ID: 403598935"}

tr.td:
5 meetings are an All Recovery based format so that they are available to the widest number of those in, seeking or supportive of recovery. They are being held at 8 am, 11 am, 2 pm, 5 pm and 10 pm.
On Tuesday night at 7:30 pm we are offering a solution based, facilitator led AA Step speaker, discussion meeting.
Learn more: https://communityincrisis.org/programs/all-recovery-support/

Support for anyone who is affected by alcoholism in a family member or friend.
https://al-anon.org/al-anon-meetings/electronic-meetings/

td.span: The State of New Jersey has developed a centralized resource to match talent with opportunities in industries on the front lines serving New Jerseyans during the outbreak.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Offer take-out and delivery at 50% off the entire menu. New temporary hours are 10 am to 8 pm daily. Can also deliver grocery items to your house daily between 1 pm and 4 pm.\nCall 856-854-7220."}

tr.td:
Offering take-out and delivery at 50% off the entire menu. New temporary hours are 10 AM – 8 PM daily. Can also deliver grocery items to homes daily 1 – 4 PM.
Call 856-854-7220.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Operating in various locations, check Facebook page for details."}

tr.td: Operating in various locations, check Facebook page for details.

td.data-sheets-value:
{"1":2,"2":"Camden County has deployed three handwashing stations at targeted locations in Camden City for the unsheltered homeless to wash their hands. They are located at


Board of Social Services near Federal Street
Joseph’s House outside of their parking lot
Broadway and Chelton in the park"}

tr.td:
Camden County has deployed three handwashing stations at targeted locations in Camden City. They are located at:
Board of Social Services near Federal Street
Joseph’s House outside of their parking lot
Broadway and Chelton in the park

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"For SNAP/Medicaid recipients: Amazon Prime is offering $5.99 monthly (instead of $12.99 monthly) if you verify your Medicaid/EBT card after the free intro period. Also, recipients will receive free shipping and access to free streaming of shows, movies, free reading materials, and more. Spreading the word in case any families may need to incorporate this into their schedule at home."}

tr.td: For SNAP/Medicaid recipients: Amazon Prime is offering $5.99 monthly (instead of $12.99 monthly) if you verify your Medicaid/EBT card after the free intro period. Also, recipients will receive free shipping and access to free streaming of shows, movies, free reading materials, and more. Spreading the word in case any families may need to incorporate this into their schedule at home.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Internet Essentials will increase speeds from 15/2 Mbps to 25/3 Mbps for all customers. This speed increase will happen automatically - no action is required by customers. In addition, new customers will receive two months of free service."}

tr.td: Internet Essentials will increase speeds from 15/2 Mbps to 25/3 Mbps for all customers. This speed increase will happen automatically – no action is required by customers. In addition, new customers will receive two months of free service.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Internet Essentials will increase speeds from 15/2 Mbps to 25/3 Mbps for all customers. This speed increase will happen automatically - no action is required by customers. In addition, new customers will receive two months of free service."}

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"offering free internet access for students. Beginning March 16, Spectrum is offering free internet for 60 days to households with K-12 or college students who don't already have a Spectrum subscription. "}

td.span: Spectrum is offering free internet for 60 days to households with K-12 or college students who don’t already have a Spectrum subscription.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Internet Essentials will increase speeds from 15/2 Mbps to 25/3 Mbps for all customers. This speed increase will happen automatically - no action is required by customers. In addition, new customers will receive two months of free service."}

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":" following the FCC agreement, providing unlimited data to existing customers, and, starting Tuesday, 3/17/2020, will allow all handsets to enable hot spots for 60 days at no extra charge."}

td.span: Participating in the FCC pledge. Sprint is providing unlimited data to existing customers. Starting Tuesday, 3/17/2020, Sprint will allow all handsets to enable hot spots for 60 days at no extra charge.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Internet Essentials will increase speeds from 15/2 Mbps to 25/3 Mbps for all customers. This speed increase will happen automatically - no action is required by customers. In addition, new customers will receive two months of free service."}

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"following the FCC agreement, plus unlimited data to existing customers, and, coming soon, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge."}

td.span: Participating in the FCC pledge. T-Mobile is providing unlimited data to existing customers. Coming soon: all handsets will be able to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge.

td.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"Internet Essentials will increase speeds from 15/2 Mbps to 25/3 Mbps for all customers. This speed increase will happen automatically - no action is required by customers. In addition, new customers will receive two months of free service."}

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":" COVID-19 response. AT&T will offer open hot-spots, unlimited data to existing customers, and $10/month plans to low-income families."}

td.span: AT&T will offer open hot-spots, unlimited data to existing customers, and $10/month plans to low-income families.
